text:
Coronavirus cases in the U.S. have increased faster in children and teenagers than among the general population.

Children seem to catch and transmit the virus less than adults, but data shows how widely the virus can affect the school-age population. https://t.co/AK50m9gGRD

name: nytimes
text: The rise in coronavirus cases among the young comes in part from more widespread testing among children. But increased hospitalizations and deaths suggest that the virus is also spreading at a higher rate among minors now than earlier this year. https://t.co/AK50m9gGRD https://t.co/d1TT7LVrwR

name: nytimes
text:
At the beginning of the summer, about 5% of U.S. coronavirus cases were documented in minors. By August 20, that number had risen to more than 9%.

Every state in the U.S. has had an increase in the share of minors who have tested positive. https://t.co/AK50m9gGRD https://t.co/NCxW3nTBF7
